company.name: Ubik Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
company.description: An innovation-led group based in India, specializing in dermatology and cosmetology with a presence in over 18 countries. Led by Mr. Ilesh Khakhkhar, the company follows a philosophy of 'Innovation in whatever we do'. Pursues exponential growth through research and development, ethics, and core values, launching innovative solutions for client needs in dermatology and cosmetology. Originating from parent company Ethicare Remedies, Ubik Solutions aims to create a workplace that eliminates bureaucracy, fosters value, growth opportunities, and self-development. The company culture prioritizes people, building a supportive environment where everyone feels appreciated, motivated, and fulfilled. Success is about positive culture and impact, delighting and empowering people at every touchpoint.
company.address: 2007, 21st Floor, Space Odyssey, 150 Feet Ring Rd, Nr. KKV Hall, Bharatvan Society, Nalanda Society, Rajkot, Gujarat 360005, India

culture.description: Aims to make Ubik the best workplace where employees feel fulfilled and contribute to a larger cause. Fosters an enjoyable work environment with pride in being an 'Ethicarian'. Achieved through consistently demonstrating core values, prioritizing values over skills. The culture is about collaboration, growth, making an impact, and going beyond the ordinary. It is a family-like community where people feel secure, supported, inspired, and comfortable voicing thoughts and challenges. This leads to creativity, collaboration, higher productivity, retention, and personal growth. The UBIK DNA book encapsulates this culture, serving as the company's guiding scripture (bhagavad gita, bible, quran), drawing from books, podcasts, videos, client insights, team contributions, and family wisdom. Inspired by Delivering Happiness by Tony Hsieh, Zappos culture, and Zomato's 'Culture' by Deepinder Goyal.

core_values.description: Seek growth and improvement by learning daily and applying knowledge to enhance personal and professional development.
core_values.importance: Keeps the company relevant and competitive in a changing world.
examples: Daily learning via UBIK Connect app
Engage in doctor waiting areas, chemist surveys, conferences
Interact with MRs, managers, receptionists, patients

core_values.description: Share ideas, tools, and insights to help others succeed before expecting returns.
core_values.importance: Builds trust, credibility, and strong relationships.
examples: Support in daily life with family/colleagues

core_values.description: Strive for exceptional quality, innovation, and service in all operations.
core_values.importance: Establishes reputation for excellence, enhances competitiveness, fosters trust and loyalty.
examples: Maintain excellence in client interactions, greetings
Exemplify in daily chores, dressing, social media

core_values.description: Actively assist colleagues and clients, going the extra mile to ensure success.
core_values.importance: Creates a positive environment of trust and teamwork.
examples: Address doctors' challenges in practice/personal life
Prioritize help requests within legal/moral bounds

core_values.description: Act ethically, honestly, accountably, and transparently at all times.
core_values.importance: Builds integrity and trust in all activities.

core_values.description: Take ownership and deliver results without excuses.
Achieve goals as a unified team, working smart and hard toward the vision.
Innovate without constraints, thinking beyond traditional boundaries.
Treat everyone with respect, care, and empathy, as if they were family.
Maintain a positive, energetic attitude with humor as a requirement.
Focus on solutions, take risks, develop leaders, and attract quality people.
Embrace speed, flexibility, and punctuality with grace.
Take full responsibility for all outcomes.
Entertain, educate, execute, and empower others.

kpis: Fred Activities and Posts Demonstrating Core Values
Self-Upgradation (Product Detailing, Doctor Rapport, Cultural Fit, Input Usage, Doctor Commitment, Activity Participation)
mr.guidelines: Adhere to core values and ethics; avoid cheating, lying, dishonesty, or missing deadlines.

zsm.title: Zonal Sales Manager (ZSM)

sales_force.description: Holds a BS in Science from Kashmir. Over 15 years in pharma sales and marketing at Ubik.

publications.title: THE UBIK DNA: The Essence of Who We Are and What We Believe In
publications.author: Ilesh Khakhkhar
publications.publisher: K Books, K House, Nr. New Gandhigram Police Station, Cute Baby Care Hospital Street, Opp. Jay Ganesh Ford, 150 Feet Ring Road, Rajkot - 360007 (Gujarat-India). Email: yogesh@kbooks.co.in | Website: www.kbooks.co.in
publications.description: A reflection of the company's culture, values, and aspirations. Not just pages, but a testament to building a positive, supportive environment. Filled with stories, lessons, and insights on collaboration and growth. Inspired by Delivering Happiness by Tony Hsieh, Zappos culture, and Zomato's 'Culture' by Deepinder Goyal. Sources include books, podcasts, videos, client interactions (dermatologists), team contributions, and family wisdom (wife Bhavini, son Utsav). Deadline set for September 30, 2024, to create urgency and demonstrate commitment from the top.

founder.name: Ilesh Khakhkhar
founder.title: Founder & Managing Director
founder.description: Founded Ethicare Remedies in 2003 with 3 products, expanded to multiple subsidiaries. Passionate about innovation in dermatology and cosmetology, with a natural ability to encourage and connect with people. Started career as a medical representative over three decades ago, experiencing bureaucracy, feeling unvalued, lack of growth, and minimal self-development. These shaped his mission to create a workplace eliminating such issues. Determined to make Ubik Solutions one of the best places to work in pharma, where people enjoy work, feel fulfilled, and build something cherished beyond lifetimes. Inspired by Tony Hsieh and Zappos to write The UBIK DNA book.

profile.work_approach: Multitasks across projects, decisive, expects team support to complete tasks.
profile.communication_preferences: Prefers WhatsApp over calls, needs reminders, often uses silent mode.
profile.health_notes: Diabetic; may exhibit unconsciousness, slow response, or behavior changes with low sugar.

family_contributions.wife: Bhavini Khakhkhar (Co-Founder, MD): Role extends beyond finances and operations to nurturing a family-like culture, creating security, support, and inspiration. Focuses on open communication, mentorship, creativity, collaboration, productivity, retention, and personal growth. Believes in building people to create lasting success. Quote: 'A successful company is built not just on systems, but on the trust and care we cultivate in the people behind it.'
family_contributions.son: Utsav Khakhkhar: Contributions to ideas in The UBIK DNA book.

subsidiaries.mission: Build a comprehensive, affordable template platform for social media content.
subsidiaries.vision: Ensure every dermatologist and cosmetologist uses the PostAdda app.
marketing_strategies: Meta ad campaigns for user acquisition
Monthly social media calendar with hashtags and tips

faqs.question: What services does PostAdda offer?
faqs.answer: Templates for skincare, haircare, procedural guides, and content for special occasions/festivals.

faqs.question: How do I use the templates?
faqs.answer: Download the app, choose and customize templates, and share on social media.

faqs.question: Is there a free trial?
faqs.answer: Yes, 10 credits with watermarked content and limited selection.

faqs.question: What are the subscription plans?
faqs.answer: 3-month, 6-month, and yearly plans with varying credits and features.

faqs.question: How often are new templates added?
Are templates customizable?
faqs.answer: Yes, users can add logos, colors, text, and shapes.

faqs.question: What support is available?
faqs.answer: Support via call, email, and WhatsApp chat.

faqs.question: How does PostAdda improve social media engagement?
faqs.answer: Consistent, high-quality content increases engagement, attracts clients, and builds brand identity.

blog.title: 5 Acne Treatment Tips You Can Use Today
blog.author: Not specified

insights.title: Widen & Deepen Your Relationships With Doctors
key_points: Build long-term relationships with doctors for success.
Engage with doctors' families and colleagues during events like birthdays.
Positive post-event discussions enhance reputation.

insights.title: Cultivate the Attitude of Playing an Infinite Game
key_points: View entrepreneurship as an infinite game with ongoing challenges.
Embrace challenges and pivot as needed.
Reflect on past challenges for solutions.
Overcoming challenges fosters personal growth.
insights.affirmation: I am not going to let my challenges overpower me. I am going to face them with a fresh perspective.

insights.title: What’s Next: Lessons Learned from Pandemic
key_points: Digitize pharmacy, training, records, onboarding, and feedback.
Prepare for unexpected crises.
Strive to exceed average performance.
Commit to learning and opportunities.
Develop leadership to navigate change.
Embrace the new normal.
insights.affirmation: I will take my chance and embrace the new normal.

insights.title: You Are Not Stuck, You Are Committed to Certain Patterns of Behaviour
key_points: Feeling stuck stems from outdated patterns; change thoughts and habits.
Life presents endless challenges; repattern thoughts to overcome.
Start with small habit changes for growth.
Mindset shift exercise: Dust yourself off.
insights.affirmation: Whenever I feel stuck in life, I am going to change my thought pattern. I am going to change the formula.

insights.title: Don't Get Too Comfortable With a Chauffeur-Driven Mercedes
key_points: Avoid complacency in success.
Stay grounded and connected to reality.
Reflect periodically to recharge and innovate.
Learn from successes to replicate and scale.

insights.title: People Behave for Their Reasons, Not Yours!
key_points: Understand others' motives to negotiate effectively.
Presume this in leadership to maintain relationships.
Example: Negotiated with staff during COVID.
insights.affirmation: I will always remember that people act and behave for their valid reasons, not for my reasons.

insights.title: 2 Most Powerful Laws of Productivity for Dermapreneurs
key_points: Pareto Principle: 80% results from 20% efforts; focus on high-impact tasks.
Parkinson's Law: Work expands to fill time; set deadlines.

insights.title: Leverage: The Most Powerful Strategy to Grow Your Practice
key_points: Leverage relationships, time, money, resources for better outcomes.
Optimize offers and practice areas.
Example: Leveraged relationship for better land deal.
insights.affirmation: I am going to look at every area in my practice where I can optimise, leverage and scale up to produce far more better yields.

insights.title: One Tactic to Double, Triple and Even Quadruple the Number of Patients Visiting Your Clinic
key_points: 60-70% income from referrals; proactively generate them.
Provide value, educate, incentivize, follow up.
Train team with 5-step referral plan.
insights.affirmation: From this day onwards, I am going to put proactive efforts in generating referrals for my practice.

insights.title: Your Competitors Don’t Want You to Know This Secret – WIIFM!
key_points: Appeal to 'What’s In It For Me' for staff and patients.
Examples: Patient comforts, flexible staff hours.
Focus on the 95% who appreciate; dedicate a WIIFM week.
insights.affirmation: Before I take any decision in my practice, I will appeal to the ‘what’s in it for me’ of the opposite person.

insights.title: Unaware Patients: The Bitter Shocking Fact
key_points: Less than 20% patients aware of all services; inform to increase usage.
Use waiting area for TVs, brochures, staff briefings.
Indoor marketing raises awareness and attracts patients.
insights.affirmation: I am going to level up my efforts in raising awareness of my patients so each of my patients knows about all the services I am offering through my practice.

insights.title: Digitize Everything in Your Practice So You Can Focus on Providing High-Quality Care
key_points: Digitize for access, security, efficiency.
Benefits: Record maintenance, time savings, secure data.
Digitize EHR, training, onboarding, marketing, payments.
Long-term investment for better care.
insights.affirmation: I am going to digitize everything in my practice.

leadership_principles.source: The 21 Irrefutable Laws of Leadership by John C. Maxwell

principles.description: Leadership ability determines a person’s effectiveness. Lower leadership ability caps potential. Assess and grow to raise your leadership lid.
True leadership is measured by influence, not titles. Influence is earned through actions, not mandated.
Leadership develops daily through consistent habits and priorities. Create a personal growth plan and set others on a path to success.
Leaders chart the course by learning from past experiences and anticipating challenges. Requires strategic planning beyond vision casting.
Leaders add value by serving others. Understand team members’ priorities and assist their growth.
Trust is the foundation of leadership. Build trust through competence, connection, and character.
People follow leaders stronger than themselves. Earn respect as a person (admiration), friend (love), and leader (followership).
Leaders evaluate with a leadership bias using facts, instinct, morale, and relational dynamics.

sales_principles.source: Jeffrey Gitomer's 12.5 Principles of Sales Greatness

principles.description: Self-motivation is key; drive yourself to success without relying on others.

principles.principle: Prepare to Win, or Lose to Someone Who Is
principles.description: Preparation distinguishes winners. Dedicate time to mastering sales skills.
Build a reputation as an expert through networking, writing, and speaking.
Focus on delivering value and building relationships; price objections indicate insufficient value.
Build relationships through networking to create wealth and opportunities.
Sell directly to decision-makers using creativity and value.
Engage prospects emotionally with smart questions and memorable interactions.
Use humor and clarity to make prospects think and connect.
Believe in your company, product, and self to sell effectively.

principles.principle: Believe It Before You Achieve It
principles.description: Self-belief and a positive attitude attract sales success.
Treat strangers as potential customers and engage everywhere.
Concentrate on your responsibilities instead of controlling everything.
Success comes from hard work, dedication, and a positive attitude.

objection_handling.strategy: Acknowledge objections, block with value-based explanations, use stories, and ask yes-oriented questions to close sales.

objections.response: Acknowledge cost but highlight quality, e.g., 'We import Glutathione from Opitac, Japan, ensuring top quality.'
Agree, but emphasize comprehensive pharma range alongside innovative cosmetics.
Agree, but clarify we don’t sell directly to third parties. We enforce agreements against online sales by partners and promote My Derma Store as the exclusive platform.
Acknowledge competitors’ schemes but highlight superior services that outweigh minimal differences.
Assure no compromise on efficacy; products are trial-tested for desired results.
Explain launches reduce competition in a dynamic market.
Acknowledge thickness but highlight benefit: 'Thick formulation ensures long-lasting hydration.'
Agree mild irritation possible due to 13 agents, but it lasts 3-4 minutes and delivers excellent results, as noted by peers.
Acknowledge cost but emphasize larger packaging, safety, and options like exfoliating/non-exfoliating peels with boosters.
Offer range for affordability: 'Z Screen or 360 Block for budget-conscious patients; Ethisun 200g for economical choice.'
Explain reasons, prepare with doctor preference surveys, and tailor calls accordingly.
Highlight unique USPs, results, and packaging; use yes questions to gain agreement.
Note top KOLs choose us for value and tools; invite doctors to experience the difference.

objections.objection: Limited Pharmacy Space for New Products
objections.response: Acknowledge space constraints but highlight unique, broad-ranging products; suggest trying 1-2 items.

forewords.author: Dr. Ganesh Pai
forewords.content: Represents the ethos of the company. Carry message of hope and healing. Formulations are complex; carry excellence of Ethicare products. Handle doctors with care; enter their mind for prescriptions. Engage on hobbies like sports, photography, music, travel. Avoid politics and religion. Right profession if you like meeting people, achieving targets, group strategies. At Guy’s and St. Thomas’ Hospital (1995), key criterion was 'ability to get along with colleagues'. Work with ethics, handle issues with care. Part of Ethinext; evaluate next opportunities. Rise above the ordinary.

forewords.author: Dr. B. S. Chandrashekar
forewords.content: In dermatology, precision meets compassion, science blends with artistry, constant pursuit of excellence. Ilesh's vision resonated; suggested sharing manifesto with dermatologists as guiding light for great workplace and culture. Immersed in manuscript; depth of wisdom and sincerity. More than guidebook; manifesto. Team goes extra mile for dermatology community. Secret: Build 'go-to people' team of 300+ A-players. Book answers how. Embark on 'THE UBIK DNA' for inspiration, guidance, renewed possibility; blueprint for elevating organizations and enriching lives.
